Text: RE Dominion gas supply Tallahassee deal on Florida Cc i agree with kays suggested approach if we are purchasing gas from another source at a higher price i would put dominion on notice that we are doing that and stating we will hold them responsible Mark C Ellenberg Cadwalader Wickersham Taft F Street NW Washington DC Mann Kay Kay NR To Germany Chris ONcom Chris NRONcom Boyt Eric Office Eric NRONcom Mark Ellenberg Email cc McMichael Jr Ed PM Ed NRONcom Subject RE Dominion gas supply Tallahassee deal on Florida Ive left a message for Dominions counsel telling him that we disagree with their position that they can terminate the gas contract and asking him to educate us as to why they dont think that action is stayed We can follow up with a letter suggesting that we believe their termination is wrongful unless Mark disagrees Second issue is whether we should attempt to pay for the gas anyway since they have to deliver gas paid for prior to termination Kay Original Message From Germany Chris Sent Wednesday March AM To Germany Chris Boyt Eric Mann Kay Mark Ellenberg Email Cc Parks Joe Concannon Ruth Polsky Phil McMichael Jr Ed Dhont Margaret Hamic Priscilla Subject RE Dominion gas supply Tallahassee deal on Florida The Tallahassee deal still has value so we want the Dominion deal to stay in place Im concerned about the st because all the money needs to be wired tomorrow At this point I believe Dominion should supply the gas for April at the contract price regardless Let me know where we stand with Dominion by PM today Thanks Original Message From Germany Chris Sent Tuesday March AM To Germany Chris McMichael Jr Ed Boyt Eric Mann Kay Cc Parks Joe Concannon Ruth Polsky Phil Subject RE Dominion gas supply Tallahassee deal on Florida The contract number assigned to this deal in Sitara is The contract number in Sitara for the Tallahassee deal is Original Message From Germany Chris Sent Tuesday March AM To McMichael Jr Ed Boyt Eric Mann Kay Cc Parks Joe Concannon Ruth Polsky Phil Subject Dominion gas supply Tallahassee deal on Florida Dominion Oklahoma Texas Exploration Production Inc successor to Louis Dreyfus Natural Gas Corp is supplying ENA dth per day at a Florida Zone This supply is matched up with ENAs sale to The City of Tallahassee I believe both deals go through March I prepay Dominion for the supply each month This morning I had a voicemail from my contact at Dominion David Walker His voicemail stated that Dominion was terminating their contract with ENA and Dominion would not be supplying any gas effective April Paul Vrana with Jackson Walker is representing Dominion he prepared the termination letter Just spoke with Paul AM he has not spoken with anyone representing Enron but he has worked with Harlam Murphy in the past He will fax a letter to me Kay I will leave a copy of the letter in your chair This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged RE EnronColumbia Gas Cc email thanks Mark C Ellenberg Cadwalader Wickersham Taft F Street NW Washington DC Germany Chris To ChrisGermany cc McMichael Jr Ed ENRONcom Ed NRONcom Shemin Proctor Office Email Mann Kay Concannon Ruth Ruth NRONcom PM Subject RE EnronColumbia Gas Im not aware of an AP rate schedule AS tariff sheet and IPP tariff sheet are separate rate schedules in the tariff AS pools are used to aggregate production meters on CGASs system and are assigned a specific geographical location on the pipeline AS pool meters can be used as primary receipt points on firm transportation agreements whereas IPP Pool meters are not Original Message From McMichael Jr Ed Sent Friday March AM To Germany Chris Subject FW EnronColumbia Gas can you help Please review the attachment and lets discuss Ed Original Message From Mark Ellenberg ENRON Sent Friday March AM To McMichael Jr Ed Cc Mann Kay Edward Smith Subject EnronColumbia Gas Shemin can you answer Ed Smiths question concerning the pooling tarriff Ed McMichael do you have knowledge concerning the EES pooling agreements Mark C Ellenberg Cadwalader Wickersham Taft F Street NW Washington DC Forwarded by Mark EllenbergDCCWT on AM Edward Smith Office To Mark WT cc Subject EnronColumbia Gas AM Two quick questions The Columbia Gas motion refers to two pooling agreements the IPP Service Agreement and the AS Service Agreement Ms Shemins e mail attaches a copy of a rate schedule entitled IPP Rate Schedule Interruptible Paper Pools Does this rate schedule also apply to the AP Service Agreement or is there another rate schedule for that agreement Can Mr McMichael swear the affidavit with respect to the pooling agreements which are with EES not ENA NOTE The information in this email is confidential and may be legally privileged If you are not the intended recipient you must not read use or disseminate the information Although this email and any attachments are believed to be free of any virus or other defect that Re FW FTS Capacity Auction Cc email pst are they auctioning our property Mark C Ellenberg Cadwalader Wickersham Taft F Street NW Washington DC Germany Chris To Concannon Ruth ChrisGermany Ruth NRONcom Mark Ellenberg ENRONcom Email Office cc Garza Maria Maria NRONcom Shemin V Proctor Email Mann Kay AM McMichael Jr Ed Ed NRONcom Subject FW FTS Capacity Auction FYI ENA has or had about of primary receipts at Venice Original Message From ENRON Sent Monday March AM To Subject FTS Capacity Auction COLUMBIA GULF TRANSMISSION COMPANY NOTICE TO ALL INTERESTED PARTIES MARCH Notice ID NO RESPONSE REQUIRED Columbia Gulf Transmission is auctioning dthd of onshore firm capacity from Venice to Rayne Louisiana at CGTs maximum onshore FTS transportation rate This capacity will be available April with bids due by pm Central Time on March Details of this capacity auction may be found in the Columbia NAVIGATOR system under the capacity release folder offer number For additional information please contact Brian Lamb at This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any RE Nation Fuel Gas Supply Corporation ENA EES Motionspst looks like there was no opposition and orders were entered rejecting the agreements Mark C Ellenberg Cadwalader Wickersham Taft F Street NW Washington DC Forwarded by Mark EllenbergDCCWT on PM Gina Marie Tuso To Mark WT cc Subject RE Nation Fuel Gas Supply PM Corporation ENA EES MotionsDocument link Mark Ellenberg I checked the docket and found each motion and the corresponding order There were no responses filed I have annexed copies of the motions and orders for ENA and EES for your review See attached file National Fuel Stay motion ENAPDFSee attached file National Fuel Stay order ENAPDFSee attached file National Fuel Stay motion EESPDFSee attached file National Fuel Stay order EESPDF Gina Marie Tuso Legal Assistant Cadwalader Wickersham Taft Maiden Lane New York New York Telephone Facsimile Email Mark Ellenberg To Mann Kay Kay NRONcom Gina Marie WT AM cc Vanderhorst Barry Barend NRONcom Germany Chris Chris NRONcom McMichael Jr Ed Ed NRONcom Garza Maria Maria NRONcom Barbe Robin Robin NRONcom Concannon Ruth Ruth NRONcom Subject RE Nation Fuel Gas Supply Corporation ENA EES MotionsDocument link Gina Marie Tuso Gina please locate these motions on the docket and see if any a response was filed and an order was entered thanks Mark C Ellenberg Cadwalader Wickersham Taft F Street NW Washington DC Mann Kay Kay NRO To Concannon Ruth Ncom Ruth NRONcom Office cc McMichael Jr Ed Ed NRONcom Garza Maria AM Maria NRONcom Germany Chris Chris NRONcom Barbe Robin Robin NRONcom Vanderhorst Barry Barend NRONcom Subject RE Nation Fuel Gas Supply Corporation ENA EES Motions Ruth this was before my time but I can check with Jeff Hodge andor Steve Van H Original Message From Concannon Ruth Sent Monday May AM To Mann Kay Cc McMichael Jr Ed Garza Maria Germany Chris Barbe Robin Vanderhorst Barry Subject Nation Fuel Gas Supply Corporation ENA EES Motions We just found out that National Fuel Gas Supply NFGS filed motions with the bankruptcy court on December to vacate the automatic stay and allow NFGS to terminate the firm and interruptible transport agreements compel the Debtor to assume or reject the agreements or provide adequate assurance of future performance by the Debtor A separate motion for ENA and EES was filed The hearing looks like it was scheduled on January I do not believe that ENAs and EESs commercial groups were aware that these NFGSs motions had been made to the court Was Legal involved in a response to these motions If ENA and EES did not respond at the court hearing is the decision of the court to terminate the agreements Most of the agreements were for interruptible services that had no future value to the Estate One of the two firm ENA agreements was tied to a producer netback transaction that Enron Canada is working on a settlement with the producer The other firm ENA agreement is outofthemoney and would have been rejected anyway Please confirm that by ENA and EES taking no action at the hearing that the agreements have been terminated I will get with Enron Canada so that fact can be included in their settlement with the producer Thanks for your help Ruth Concannon RE Nation Fuel Gas Supply Corporation ENA EES Motions Cc Gina please locate these motions on the docket and see if any a response was filed and an order was entered thanks Mark C Ellenberg Cadwalader Wickersham Taft F Street NW Washington DC Mann Kay Kay NRO To Concannon Ruth Ncom Ruth NRONcom Office cc McMichael Jr Ed Ed NRONcom Garza Maria AM Maria NRONcom Germany Chris Chris NRONcom Barbe Robin Robin NRONcom Vanderhorst Barry Barend NRONcom Subject RE Nation Fuel Gas Supply Corporation ENA EES Motions Ruth this was before my time but I can check with Jeff Hodge andor Steve Van H Original Message From Concannon Ruth Sent Monday May AM To Mann Kay Cc McMichael Jr Ed Garza Maria Germany Chris Barbe Robin Vanderhorst Barry Subject Nation Fuel Gas Supply Corporation ENA EES Motions We just found out that National Fuel Gas Supply NFGS filed motions with the bankruptcy court on December to vacate the automatic stay and allow NFGS to terminate the firm and interruptible transport agreements compel the Debtor to assume or reject the agreements or provide adequate assurance of future performance by the Debtor A separate motion for ENA and EES was filed The hearing looks like it was scheduled on January I do not believe that ENAs and EESs commercial groups were aware that these NFGSs motions had been made to the court Was Legal involved in a response to these motions If ENA and EES did not respond at the court hearing is the decision of the court to terminate the agreements Most of the agreements were for interruptible services that had no future value to the Estate One of the two firm ENA agreements was tied to a producer netback transaction that Enron Canada is working on a settlement with the producer The other firm ENA agreement is outofthemoney and would have been rejected anyway Please confirm that by ENA and EES taking no action at the hearing that the agreements have been terminated I will get with Enron Canada so that fact can be included in their settlement with the producer Thanks for your help Ruth Concannon This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole Re Boston Gas Cc i think tenessee was asleep on this one until i spoke with their counsel yesterday could explain the timing of the call from boston gas they should not have to pay both us and the pipeline Mark C Ellenberg Cadwalader Wickersham Taft F Street NW Washington DC Germany Chris To Concannon Ruth Ruth NRONcom ChrisGermany ENRONcom cc Garza Maria Maria NRONcom McMichael Jr Ed Office Ed NRONcom Mann Kay Subject Boston Gas PM I just received a call from Joe Krajewski x at Boston Gas He is a Resource Management Analyst at Boston Gas working for Liz Danehy According to Joe ENA is still billing Boston Gas for part of the demand charges on the long term producer netback deal that Ruth is so familiar with This is Iroquois and Tennessee capacity I am releasing back to Boston Gas each month at a demand rate Joe asked me why we were doing this and I told him that ENA was probably not paying the capacity bills and Boston Gas was aware of that fact and knew Boston Gas would be liable for the demand charges anyway Sounds like Boston Gas may be getting double billed and Joe said they will probably not pay the invoice This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant
